artist: Artist: Utagawa Hiroshige; Publisher: Jōshūya Kinzō
catalogue_raissonne: Ukiyo-e shūka 14 (1981), Hiroshige list, p. 249, ōban #65.6
creditline: Gift of Louis W. Hill, Jr.
dimension:
14 9/16 × 9 13/16 in. (37 × 25 cm) (image, sheet, vertical ōban)
19 × 15 × 1 1/2 in. (48.26 × 38.1 × 3.81 cm) (outer frame)
inscription: {Shitō no tsuyu no soko ni noko n no hana no iro / Suichiku no kemuri no naka ni kure no tori no koe} (Dew forms on the flowers of purple wisteria. The color of flowers remains in the dew./ Mist settles in the green bamboo forest. The voice of evening birds echoes in the mist.)
markings: Tōkaidō 極 seal; censor seal: 極 {kiwame}; publisher\'s seal: Jōkin
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
portfolio: From Anthology of Japanese and Chinese Poems for Recitation (Wakan rōei-shū 和漢朗詠集)
title: Swallows and Wisteria
